title: Why does my Black friend say that we Asian Americans don’t face any racism? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because Racism is an exquisite kind of evil…it only shows its face to its intended victim. Like Bullying, No-one else sees it. You never see the nice neighbor when he or she is spewing the n-word at black children that walk too close to his lawn. He always shows a smile at you. Likewise, your Black friend isn’t there if you ever have to grit your teeth through ‘Ching-Chong Chinaman’ (And Yes, stupid white people still say that stupid little ditty…they think it’s riotously funny, but only when an Asian American hears it behind their back). But if your Black Friend is present, nothing will be said. Your Black friend is not there at work when you, being the most qualified person on the team, get passed over for the White guy…because it’s naturally assumed by the White Manager that a ‘Good’ Asian Team Member work best as ‘Support’…but never ‘Leadership’. You’re there to help Them Move Up…but not to move up yourself ‘Over Them’. Then there are the little lesser slights…Like: Your Black friend isn’t there when a friend brings a guest with them to your home and you sit down with your Family for dinner…maybe mashed potatoes and fried chicken…and the guest insouciantly asks: “I thought we were gonna have pork fried rice or butterfly shrimp or something.” (I call this offense the Weird White Ethnic Food Rule: That’s when White People think that the whole reason for the existence of other ethnicities is to provide them with Restaurant Cuisine) Your Black friend isn’t there when an associate or a neighbor thinks it’s a riot to mimic a bad ‘Charley Chang’ accent and you just grit your teeth. Then there’s the History Thing: Your Black Friend does not know what Your Father or your Grandfather went through and endured in the past… Your Black Friend, like most White Americans, never actually thought of the social and political reasons WHY every city had a ‘China Town’. Your Black Friend, like Most White Americans only learned of Chinese/Asian History that connects to Western Civilization from our High School History Books: Which basically only amounts to The Opium Wars— which don’t paint the Chinese side of the situation in a good light. (But the fact that the British made an entire economic Trade model on being Opium Drug Dealers…is kind of never really pointed out.) Or the fact that Chinese workers were key to the expansion of the Railway Systems out west? I learned of these things from my room-mate in college late one night after he threw an unabridged dictionary at me in anger (He missed on purpose, Thank God! — Unabridged Dictionaries are VERY BIG. That’s how angry he was). I had said something, unthinkingly…and his anger boiled out. He was angry at me because even though, he gritted his teeth and bore it from others…he wanted ‘Better’ from the person he called his Friend. This is why I counter the easy argument from most unthinking White People who say things like: “Asian Americans are Good Minorities” by telling them: “You have NO freakin’ idea how much repressed anger you’re playing with.” If this fellow is STILL your Friend … next time, just out of the blue … TELL HIM some little piece of Your Family’s History. Tell him some of the History that he was Never Taught in History Class. Because History is the crucible defines Us. And while Racism affects you differently…and you react differently…your Friend, if he is a Good Friend, should go quiet as he processes what you reveal and compares it to what he knows—and what he never knew. And Goodness knows, Life’s Travails become easier to bear when you know you have Friends who can understand…even if you don’t outwardly say anything. Good Luck!!

Stereotypes exist in real life and on the whole, they are often true. However and individual, as a sample of one, doesn’t represent a stereotype. All that said, Asians ARE discriminated against. However, race also plays in their favor. They have strong family bonds/support, are encouraged to advance in education. They often do what other less successful races should do. That success makes your Black friend jealous. Sadly, many Black have been raised to assume the “victim” role. It is like cancer and destroys generations of Black families.
